sentence: Mr. JACKSON of Illinois. Madam Speaker, my apologies for not voting  in person today. My flight was delayed. Had I been present, I would  have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 115, H.R. 530, and YEA on Roll Call No.  116, H.R. 36.                             personal explanation

Mr. CUELLAR. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to vote today due to adverse  weather delaying my flight to Washington, D.C. Had I been present, I  would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 240 and YEA on Roll Call No. 241.
Mrs. RAMIREZ. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 333 and NAY on Roll Call No. 334.                             Personal Explanation

Ms. TITUS. Mr. Speaker, I was absent from the floor and missed Roll  Call Nos. 306 and 307. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on  Roll Call No. 306 and YEA on Roll Call No. 307.                             personal explanation

Mrs. TRAHAN. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to attend the first vote  series today due to a delayed flight into Washington, D.C. Had I been  present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 71, YEA on Roll Call  No. 72, NAY on Roll Call No. 73, and NAY on Roll Call No. 74.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
Ms. JOHNSON of Texas. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have  voted YEA on Roll Call No. 43.

Ms. LEE of Nevada. Mr. Speaker, my votes were not recorded today. Had  they been recorded, I would have voted: YEA on Roll Call No. 191, YEA  on Roll Call No. 192, and YEA on Roll Call No. 193.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
Mrs. RAMIREZ. Mr Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 85, H.R. 997.                             personal explanation

…personal explanation

Mr. GOLDMAN of New York. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to vote today due  to an important personal matter. Had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 335 and YEA on Roll Call No. 336.                             personal explanation

Ms. TITUS. Mr. Speaker, I was absent from the floor and missed Roll  Call Nos. 71 through 74. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on  Roll Call No. 71, H.R. 6329, YEA on Roll Call No. 72, S. 2503, NAY on  Roll Call No. 73, the previous question on H. Res. 1075, and NAY on  Roll Call No. 74, adoption of H.…
Ms. CROCKETT. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 333 and NAY on Roll Call No. 334.                             personal explanation
Mr. SUBRAMANYAM. Madam Speaker, I regret that I was not present to  vote on Roll Call No. 115. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 115.

Mr. NADLER. Mr. Speaker, I missed votes due to a personal matter. Had  I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 333 and NAY on  Roll Call No. 334.                                  Personal Explanation
Ms. CRAIG. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA on  Roll Call No. 159.
Ms. DelBENE. Mr. Speaker, I necessarily had to miss the vote. Had I  been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 305.
Mr. GROTHMAN. Mr. Speaker, I was attending a vital meeting. Had I  been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 119.
Mr. FEENSTRA. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to be present for this vote.  Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 305.
Mr. HUIZENGA. Madam Speaker, I was delayed on the way to the floor  and missed the vote. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll  Call No. 32.

Mr. BRECHEEN. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably detained due to illness  and was unable to cast my vote on Roll Call No. 175.

Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 175.
Mr. SHREVE. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on ROLL CALL No. 281.
Mr. ALLEN. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA on  Roll Call No. 67.
Mr. LaHOOD. Mr. Speaker, I was unexpectedly detained during vote  proceedings. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call  No. 242 and YEA on Roll Call No. 243.

Mr. BAIRD. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA on  Roll Call No. 129.

Mr. McCORMICK. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 56.

Mr. SCOTT FRANKLIN of Florida. Mr. Speaker, I missed the previous  question vote as I was in a constituent meeting. Had I been present, I  would have voted…
Mr. WOMACK. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably absent and unable to vote.  Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 29, NAY on  Roll Call No. 30, and YEA on Roll Call No. 31.
Mr. SMITH of Nebraska. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably detained. Had I  been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 299.
